revised_title: Geometrical Proof of the Theorem of a Double Six of Straight Lines
tldr: The author presents a geometrical proof of the theorem of a double six of straight lines, which states that if 11 lines are in specific relations, there exists a line intersecting 1', 2', 3', and 4'. The proof involves the use of projective geometry and demonstrates the existence of a line meeting certain conditions, providing a deeper understanding of geometric theorems and their applications.
